SUPPLIER AGREEMENT
Eudia Al
About this document
This is a Supplier Agreement, it sets the terms
for quality, compliance, sale of goods, pricing,
and right to reject. It appears to be a template
and doesn't have key informations yet like
start date, counter-party.
This Supplier Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into executed as of [Insert Date],
by and between among [Buyer Company Name], with its principal place of business at having its
main office located at [Buyer Address] (the "Buyer"), and [Supplier Company Name], with its
principal place of business at whose principal location is [Supplier Address] (the "Supplier").
WHEREAS, Buyer wishes to purchase certain goods and/or services from Supplier; and
WHEREAS, Supplier desires to provide such goods and/or services to Buyer under the terms and
conditions set forth herein;
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, the
parties agree as follows:
1.1 Supply of Goods and/or Services. The Supplier agrees to manufacture, sell, and deliver to the
Buyer, and the Buyer agrees to purchase from the Supplier agrees to supply to the Buyer, and
the Buyer shall purchase from the Supplier the goods and/or services as described in Exhibit A
attached to this Agreement (the "Products" and/or "Services"). All goods and services shall be
delivered in good condition and conform to the specifications, standards, quality requirements, and
performance criteria as set forth in Exhibit A must be delivered free from defects and in
accordance with the specifications, standards, and performance parameters detailed in
Exhibit A. The Supplier shall provide all labor, materials, equipment, and facilities necessary to
perform its obligations shall furnish all labor, materials, equipment, and other resources
necessary to meet its obligations, and shall comply with all applicable laws and regulations in
connection therewith shall remain in full compliance with all applicable laws, regulations,
and industry standards.
1.2 Ordering Procedure. The Buyer shall place orders for goods and/or services by issuing
written purchase orders referencing this Agreement. Each purchase order shall include, at a
minimum, a description of the goods or services requested, quantities, requested delivery dates,
delivery location, and any specific billing instructions. The Supplier shall confirm or reject each
purchase order within five (5) business days of receipt. A binding contract for the supply of goods
and/or services described in such purchase order shall arise only upon the Supplier's written
acceptance of the purchase order. Supplier shall not unreasonably withhold or delay acceptance of
any properly issued purchase order.

FOB destination to the address specified by Buyer in the applicable purchase order or Exhibit A.
"FOB destination" shall mean that risk of loss and title to the goods shall pass from Supplier to

Greenwashing
File Name.docx

A 止
Zero environmental impact
Rationale:
The phrase 'zero environmental impact' is a broad,
unqualified general environmental benefit claim that
is difficult to substantiate.
FTC Green Guide:
• FTC Green Guide § 260.6
Relevant Case Law:
• Volkswagen 'Clean Diesel' (Automotive)
Mitigation:
Replace with specific, measurable environmental
benefits that can be substantiated.
Risk Moderate

Project Nebula
Sources 1
What are the specific damages being claimed
and what is the legal basis of each claim
An analysis of the indemnification clauses in the provided contracts reveals key
differences in the scope of protections offered to the parties. The Aura MSA serves
as a strong standard for mutual and specific indemnification obligations.
Aura MSA (Gold Standard)
The Aura MSA contains well-defined, mutual indemnification clauses:
°
Agency's Indemnity: Momentum Digital Group LLC is required to indemnify Aura
Living Inc. for any third-party claims that arise from the agency's gross
negligence, willful misconduct, or a breach of its warranty. This warranty
specifically states that the final deliverables will not infringe on any U.S.
copyright, trademark, or trade secret rights of a third party.
• Client's Indemnity: Aura Living Inc. must indemnify the agency against third-
party claims resulting from the nature or marketing of its products or from a
breach of its own warranty. This client warranty confirms that any materials
provided to the agency do not infringe on third-party rights.
GeneVantage Therapeutics MSA
The indemnity language in the GeneVantage agreement is also mutual but differs in
its specifics when compared to the Aura MSA:
• Provider's Indemnity: CliniStat Solutions, LLC indemnifies GeneVantage
Therapeutics against third-party claims stemming from the infringement of a
third party's patent or copyright by the deliverables, any material breach of the
agreement by the provider, or the provider's gross negligence or willful
misconduct.
